alert.note: Alert for Moffat (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 1:24PM MDT until May 29 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Colorado... Yampa River near Maybell affecting Moffat County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt the snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Yampa River near Maybell. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, the Yampa River reaches bankfull in spots which would result in minor flooding of low-lying agricultural land and some bank erosion. At 11.0 feet, the boat ramp in the Maybell Bridge Campground/Yampa River Access Point becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate near bankfull conditions through Friday. Then, water levels are expected to rise over the weekend, with a max of 10.2 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage by Monday morning. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Yampa River Maybell 12.0 9.8 Thu 12 pm MD 9.8 10.1 10.2 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
